intro: Circaea lutetiana var. taquetii, commonly known as the Taquet's wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. It is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species in certain areas.
